attributes.action: HMRC to make tackling tax evaders its top priority.
attributes.background: The concern is that current direction at the HMRC is compromised; with its focus away from the 'privileged' inner-circle, and instead spread ineffectively elsewhere.
attributes.additional_details: The well known Pareto Principle or 80-20 rule is widely applied in business. It says that the best results are achieved by spending 80 percent of effort on the top 20 percent of prospects by value. Using the same principle; HMRC should target large-sum avoidance by spending 80% of its resources on the top 20% of companies and individuals by the potential revenue that could be recovered.

attributes.action: Protect and support the Forest of Dean wildlife especially the wild boar.
attributes.background: The Forest of Dean is unique. It is home to a vast array of wildlife including boar. The health of the wildlife is watched over by  charitable organisations. Because of the nature of the forest it's not unusual for boar to roam in to areas populated by humans. This isn't taken to kindly.
attributes.additional_details: It is our belief that such wild animals will only breed to their environment and if left alone will not over breed. We would like a vast majority of the forest to be a safe zone for our wildlife. And we would like full support for the charities and education to residents in the forest that the flora, fauna and wildlife should be cherished as an I portent part of our heritage.

attributes.action: Reform the democratic system to work honestly for the people it serves.
attributes.background:
Many people voted for Brexit to regain power. The ‘remain’ people want the same. It unites us both. We all want to have control over our own lives. Primarily this depends on a government genuinely working for us. This requires a total reformation of our systems of democracy. 
So we demand,
attributes.additional_details:
Proportional representation.
A published declaration of party policies/intentions before general elections, which must be held.
Early general elections called if those promises are broken.
An elected upper house.
A cap on donations of £5000 - instead state funding for a system owned by the people it serves and policies not able to be bought.
A law ensuring the media correct any inaccuracies or misleading statements on the same page, fitting format with the original article, with an apology.

attributes.action: Parliament to make 24th June a  public bank holiday if the UK vote to leave EU
attributes.background:
If the people of the UK choose to leave the European Union on the 23rd June we request that the British Parliament mark the event / people's decision with a Public Bank Holiday to be known as Britain Independence day from Europe.
(This is about the Country being free of Europe, not race/ religion )

attributes.action: Delete "journalism, art or literature" exemptions from the FOI Act
attributes.background: Schedule 1, Part VI of the Freedom Of Information Act 2000 lists a number of organisations granted special exemption, where the Act only applies to information "held for purposes other than those of journalism, art or literature". This is misused to reject ANY FOI requests they'd rather not answer.
attributes.additional_details:
They use a very loose interpretation of this exemption to support these rejections, as everything they do can be linked back to one of these three categories.

They make frequent use of the Act to interrogate other public sector organisations in their journalistic research, yet use the JAoL clause to shield themselves from similar investigation.

We therefore request that these exemptions be deleted from the FOI Act, leaving them open to the same level of scrutiny as other public bodies.

attributes.action: Re-open Hemel Hempstead Hospital
attributes.background: Sign to try help re open Hemel Hempstead hospital.

attributes.action: Hold a public vote on the options for the future UK/EU (and global) trade model
attributes.background: In June the UK electorate voted to leave the EU by a narrow majority. It has since become clear that there was no clear plan defined and little information given about the options. A public decision can only be valid if a clear intent of the direction the government wishes to take us is proposed.
attributes.additional_details:
The outcome of the advisory referendum on 23rd June means that the government must now propose defined exit plans for terms of leaving the EU.

However, leaving the EU is too momentous a decision to proceed without a clear understanding of the proposed model.

We call for a public vote to be held before Article 50 is invoked, on the options for the future UK/EU (and global) trade model with impartial assessments of the consequences of each option, including the option of staying in the EU.

attributes.action: Make youth services a statutory provision for local authorities.
attributes.background: At present, local authorities do not need to provide youth services, legally. As a result of this, the majority of LA's have axed their youth services.This petition would seek to protect youth services in law, so that young people have a strong support network and develop skills people need for life
attributes.additional_details: A government report into the 2011 London Riots linked the closure of youth provision in North London to the violence seen in London. It costs  £200,000 of taxpayers money for every young person who passes through the criminal justice system by the age of 16 (Audit Commission). For every young person who accesses youth services, it costs £350 per young person.That's a huge amount of money saved. By protecting young services we not only save money,we help to build confident and skilled individuals

attributes.action: Set statutory requirements and laws for rehoming centres to follow in our land
attributes.background: My niece wanted to rehome a dog.She contacted a local rehoming centre.The centre contacted her regarding a dog they thought would suit. On 5th November 2013 the dog turned and savaged to death our Lexi. Inquest revielled alot of things.Let's hope Lexi's Law stops families going through same pain.
attributes.additional_details: Mr Kirkland was surprised no national Standards for which any policy for rehoming should be considered  & no statutory requirements for kennels to make home visits once an animal has been placed in what is believed to be a suitable home.

attributes.action: Harsher Laws on Animal Cruelty offences In The UK. 3 Year Minimum Sentence.
attributes.background: The animal welfare act 2006 has simply not done enough to reduce animal cruelty cases. RSPCA report many cases where horrific acts of cruelty are being met with a five year disqualification for keeping animals and a fine. Abuse that includes setting dogs on fire. The law has to change.

attributes.action: We want to stop event organisers charging 'booking fees' added to every ticket
attributes.background: It has become normal for event organisers to charge a 'booking fee' to every transaction and usually added to the face value of every ticket. This is not a booking fee and does not reflect any cost incurred by the event organiser in selling tickets.
attributes.additional_details: Booking fees may have stemmed from third-party sales of event tickets but are now charged by event organisers themselves, as a way of hiking the face value of tickets. The event organiser does not incur any additional cost in selling tickets - this is the normal course of their business, and the equivalent of a supermarket charging a 'shopping fee.'

attributes.action: Repeal the decision that forces hospitals to stop providing heart surgery.
attributes.background: Three hospitals in Leicester, Manchester and London have just been ordered to stop surgery on patients born with heart disorders by April 2017. This puts the lives of many patients at risk. Force our government to invest in heart units and not to abandon those, like me, with heart conditions.
attributes.additional_details: If a standard of care is deemed unsatisfactory every effort should be made to raise that standard considerably to save lives. Our government shouldn't be abandoning people with heart disorders and rejecting the phenomenal work of those doctors who strive to provide the best care for their patients. This decision will also force patients and their families to travel great and costly distances. The government is putting lives at an even greater risk by shutting down these services.

attributes.action: Thinner lenses be free on the NHS for those registered partially sighted/blind
attributes.background: I was registered as partially sighted at 16 and blind at 19. My eyesight is constantly deteriorating and at a quicker pace than most. The need for glasses is essential. I now require complex lenses, thinner lenses are essential and they are very costly.
attributes.additional_details:
Those with complex lenses do get a voucher but that only equates to approximately £14. One pair of glasses cost me nearly £300.

The buy one get one free offers advertised do not include thinner lenses so if a second pair is required (eg prescription sunglasses which with some conditions light has a major impact) you have to pay twice for the lenses.

I currently have thinner lenses in my latest pair and from the side they are at least 0.75cm thick so would be considerably worse without

attributes.action: Make Defibrillators a Legal Requirement in Schools and Public Places
attributes.background: Just like fire extinguishers, defibrillators are life saving pieces of equipment, and yet to most, are unheard-of. Whilst they are beginning to appear in more and more public places, there aren't nearly enough located in places where fire extinguishers, for example, are mandatory.
attributes.additional_details: Cardiac arrest can occur anywhere, at any given time. In such a circumstance, time is vital. Having life-saving equipment nearby will undoubtedly play a huge part in saving the patient's life should this occur.

attributes.action: Implement the 10 recommendations of the APPG Inquiry Into Quality of New Homes.
attributes.background: The poor quality of new homes is not new. (NHBC, Barker Review of 2004, Office of Fair Trading Market Study of Home Building in the UK October 2008, and more recently the APPG Inquiry 2016) Yet surprisingly, there has not been any legislation to force this industry to improve.
attributes.additional_details:
Around 93% of new home buyers (at least 100,000 a year) report problems to their housebuilder. Defects that could and should have been prevented. The APPG Report is quite clear, the industry needs to be forced to improve both the quality of new homes and the indifferent service suffered by those buying new homes.

As a minimum, the government must implement the APPG Inquiry's “Key Recommendation” - the setting up of a New Homes Ombudsman by the DCLG within 3 months.

attributes.action: End the Breed Specific Legislation
attributes.background: BSL permits unfair treatment of certain dog breeds based on stereotypes. This is a petition to end the BSL. A new law should be brought in to replace the Dangerous Dogs act to ensure responsibility for a dog’s behaviour is placed on the owner or person in charge of it.
attributes.additional_details: It is the owners responbility to control there own dog or a dog they are in charge of. Also to seek help if their dog or a dog they are in charge of shows signs of aggression or behavioural problems.

attributes.action: Ultra sound scans of ovaries as part of the smear screening process
attributes.background: My name is Sam. I'm a 31 year old mother of 2. I've always stayed up to date with my checks. Having had a baby 8 month ago delivered by c section I had a tender pain in my abdomen still to this day. After being admitted to A&E suspected appendicitis. It turns out I have a 17cm cyst on my ovary
attributes.additional_details:
If it wasn't for the sharp pain I experienced one day. I would never have know about this cyst. I have an appointment now to have a full hysterectomy (my choice as I want no risk of anything returning). As the cyst is classed as suspicious. 
I believe if you arrange for ultra sounds to be done at the same appointment as women having smear tests. We can reduce the risk of other women living with these possibly life threatening undetected growths.

attributes.action: Abolish the House of Lords
attributes.background: No-one in the House of Lords is elected. The House of Lords should be abolished, and either replaced with a democratically elected equivalent, or not replaced at all.

attributes.action: Create a separate PIP assesment for mental disabilities
attributes.background: The current PIP assessment is designed for physical disabilities and does not ask the correct questions for people with mental health issues. Therefore people with mental health issues are loosing out on funds they are entiltled too. MENTAL HEALTH MATTERS

attributes.action: Stop classifying cats as "property" under UK law
attributes.background: Recently in the U.K. there have been a number of cases of people killing cats, U.K. Law means these people are only charged with damage to property, the law needs changing to reflect reality, that cats are not property but family members.
attributes.additional_details: The law for a long time has failed animals, we now need to start punishing these crimes accordingly. There is an acknowledged link between animal cruelty and violence against other humans, another reason that classifying a breathing living creature as "property" is barbaric.

attributes.action: Create an awareness campaign to highlight  the symptoms of type 1 diabetes
attributes.background:
Type 1 diabetes is on the increase in the UK, the biggest increase is in children, especially those under the age of 5 years old.
Unfortunately many people are unaware of the symptoms which can lead to deadly results. A delay in diagnosis can be fatal, children are dying needlessly.
attributes.additional_details:
Type 1 diabetes is a condition which is completely mis-understood, it has nothing to do with lifestyle, which is a common misconception. It complicates even the most simplest of tasks. 
There has never been a campaign that educates parents and medical professionals in the symptoms of Type 1 diabetes. Once diagnosed, and with the correct treatment and support nothing is impossible. You only have to look at our Prime Minister. 
Education is the key.

attributes.action: Upgrade the A34 to modern 3 lane motorway standards.
attributes.background: The A34 is a very busy dual carriageway carrying ever increasing levels of traffic between the Midlands and down to the South Coast. The road was built for a bygone era and is no longer fit for purpose. There have now been numerous fatalities and serious accidents on this road in recent times.
attributes.additional_details: With the exception of the Newbury Bypass and the improved junction with the M4, the rest of the road from the M40 all the way down to Winchester was constructed in the 1970s. Bends, gradients, junctions and sight lines are not up to modern standards. The solution would be to widen and totally reconstruct the road, realigning it where necessary. If needed, funds could be found by not spending £900+ million earmarked for making the M4 around Reading a "smart motorway". The A34 is much more urgent.

attributes.action: Make more treatments available on the NHS for Lipoedema patients.
attributes.background: Lipoedema is a genetic adipose tissue disorder which causes patients legs & arms to grow largely out of proportion. This can be an incredibly painful, embarrassing & debilitating condition. It's estimated to affect 11% of women worldwide
attributes.additional_details: The only way to effectively treat this condition is surgery. It doesn't just effect women, lipoedema can effect men as well. Patients with Lipoedema have painful, enlarged, lumpy, misshaped and often badly bruised arms and legs. Currently patients are left to suffer as the disfiguration of the limbs becomes more pronounced, the pain increases and their mobility and enjoyment of everyday activities decreases. Please sign this petition and get the Lipoedema patients the treatment they deserve.

attributes.action: Revoke and Repeal the Act of Union 1707 (Treaty of Union)
attributes.background: In 1707 two Acts of Parliament was formed. This is called the 'Treaty of Union'. Revoke that Act to renegotiated and push for separate independent states. ie a 'United England'
attributes.additional_details: The Acts of Union were two Acts of Parliament: the Union with Scotland Act 1706 passed by the Parliament of England, and the Union with England Act passed in 1707 by the Parliament of Scotland. They put into effect the terms of the Treaty of Union that had been agreed on 22 July 1706, following negotiation between commissioners representing the parliaments of the two countries. By the two Acts, the Kingdom of England and the Kingdom of Scotland—which at the time were separate states with separate legislatures, but with the same monarch—were, in the words of the Treaty, "United into One Kingdom by the Name of Great Britain"

attributes.action: Better care and treatment of people with Neurological Disorders, under UK Law
attributes.background: There are many of British Citizens today, living with various Neurological Disorders, but unlike people with Mental Health issues, there are no strategies, for their conditions, the above when being dealt by the Police or CPS, they also want to treated equally under UK Law.

attributes.action: Stop Making Tax Digital because it will be hugley burdensome on small businesses
attributes.background: HMRC is pushing ahead with Making Tax Digital: a scheme that will force all business to maintain digital accounts. Currently most small businesses use paper accounting records or spreadsheets. Small businesses lack the skills, time and funding to maintain digital accounts.
attributes.additional_details: Contrary to what HMRC have said, small businesses will not benefit from MTD. Making Tax Digital is a misnomer because businesses have been filing digital tax returns for 20 years. HMRC would gain from MTD because HMRC would receive more detailed trading information for businesses. Whilst HMRC needs to ensure it collects the correct tax, HMRC completely under estimates the cost of compliance on small businesses.

attributes.action: STOP the roll out of PIP in Scotland until the new Scottish benefit agency opens
attributes.background: Currently the Conservatives are rolling out PIP around Scotland affecting millions of people but I think this should be stopped in Scotland until the new Scottish benefit agency in announced and operating

attributes.action: Make Commercial Dog Walking a licensed and inspected practice.
attributes.background: In recent years, Commercial dog walking has become big business. Seemingly, all people need is a van & a love of dogs. Some provide excellent service helping our dogs to have a better life whilst we work, however there are many who walk up to 20 dogs, do not clean up, & cannot control the pack.
attributes.additional_details: Kennels & Boarders are licenced & inspected & must be suitable people, trained and insured to protect OUR pets. I have seen many Commercial Dog Walkers who cannot control the dogs they walk. The dogs foul areas & act as a pack, causing fear/ injury to other dog walkers, dogs, livestock & land users. A license should be a requirement to allow Authorities to inspect vehicles used to transport dogs, check on insurance and the walkers experience. Numbers walked commercially must also be limited.

attributes.action: Bring VAT back down to 15% immediately after EU exit has been completed
attributes.background: Give honest working UK tax payers and families a much needed economical boost and shot in the arm. With new global trade deals now possible and a recouped EU membership bill lets force competition in the market place and give the consumer a chance to really contribute to incrrasing overall GDP

attributes.action: Create a Ministerial position for the Self Employed
attributes.background:
There are almost 4.8 million self employed people in the UK who have no direct representation in Government.  Whilst there is a Minister for Small Business (which is applauded), the needs of the self employed, in many cases, are very different to even small employers.
This needs to be addressed
attributes.additional_details:
Areas that need addressing include (but are not limited to):

- The need for a 'self employed bank account' - A simple transactional account
- Affordable financial services - Realistically priced income protection and medical cover should be introduced.
- The levelling of the playing field in terms of maternity and paternity
- Increased Pension provision - employees are being encouraged to enrolled into a Workplace Pension.  What is the sole trader equivalent?   

What else can you add?

attributes.action: Support our teachers in the UK and protect our children's education.
Make the 5th of July NHS day, and a national holiday.
attributes.background: I feel that many now, so far on from it's inception truly understand a lot about when and how it started. As a whole, we just take it for granted, and have become blase about it. Yet it's treated all of us, saved lives, including my own, and more than once. It deserves to be celebrated by us all.

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence to dump animals.
attributes.background: Many charities like Animal Aid have to rescue many dumped kittens and puppies on a daily basis because of people just abandoning them on the street in a box. I want it to be illegal to dump animals and for people who do to be never allowed to have pets again.

attributes.action: Intervene  NOW with the Government of Indonesia to  reprieve Lindsay SandIford
attributes.background: The severity of the sentence was greeted with shock because prosecutors had not recommended the death penalty for Sandiford. The ruling was also condemned by the British government and anti–death penalty campaigners. It's also contrary to International Law, which we should uphold and enforce!
attributes.additional_details: Guardian articles , 28 April 2016,and 14 June 2016. Wickipaedia entry "Linsay Sandiford. Numerous other press reports in all reputable newspapers and international media

attributes.action: Referendum on the renewal of the Trident nuclear submarine programme
attributes.background: We should be able to make the decision on whether or not the UK Government spends billions of pounds on the Trident nuclear missile programme, or if we would like it to be spent elsewhere within our economy as some sources estimate that renewal could be upwards of £200bn.

attributes.action: Invest an extra £350 million per week in to the NHS
attributes.background: As widely publicised by the leave campaign, the government can afford to spend 350 million pounds on the NHS per week with the money they will now save from EU membership. As a key message in the leave campaign - this should now be implemented. The NHS and the public needs this investment.

attributes.action: Reduce the ielts score for English born nurses who completed nursing outside EU
attributes.background:
I was born & school/colleged in the UK, then travelled to NZ in 2004 & completed my nursing degree & worked in Emergency. I am now struggling to come back & work in the UK due to british council requirements of the ielts score of 7 which has nothing to do with Nursing! 
Please sign if you agree
attributes.additional_details:
British citizen school/college in Portsmouth.
Trained in New Zealand as nurse at University.
Now trying to continue nursing in own country but too many barriers in doing so, due to British council policies in making everyone sit the ielts exam at £150 per time which has NOTHING to do with Nursing. 
UK hospitals screaming out for nurses, something needs to change, I'M ENGLISH and passionate about my nursing.
please share/sign and help if you agree

attributes.action: Stop the new changes to GCSE which will penalise dyslexic pupils.
attributes.background: Dyslexic pupils can lose 5% of their marks in English literature, geography, history and religious studies due to poor spelling. Why should these pupils be discriminated against because of their disability
attributes.additional_details: Dyslexic experts, educationists and teachers' unions say the new rules on marking, announced by the Department for Education last month, will penalise hundreds of thousands with a genuine spelling disability and make it more difficult for them to reach target grades. A spokesman for Ofqual confirmed there would be no special exemptions from the marking regime for dyslexic pupils.

attributes.action: Make a law about the ratio of staff to residents in a care home with dementia.
attributes.background: I have seen how things are run in my mother's care home and we are neglecting these vulnerable people. There are not enough staff for the care and well being of the residents. I am one of very few relatives who visit regularly. After all most of us will end up in this situation.
attributes.additional_details:
Of course the answer is that more staff are needed
At the moment there is no law regulating the ratio of staff per resident, only guidelines set out by CQC, which in essence let the care home decide the best way to manage their staff. So it’s a money issue - care homes charge between £700 to £1000 per week. My mother is self funded so we are eating our way through her savings very quickly, she has a terminal illness just like many others but her treatment is not fre

attributes.action: Review the Child Maintenance system, and the people employed to serve there.
attributes.background: We, resident and non resident parents and carers, believe that the current child maintainance system is not fit for purpose and that it should be reviewed. Service users find that the system is treating them unfairly, that the employees can be unprofessional and that there is maladministration.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.gov.uk/child-maintenance
https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maladministration

attributes.action: Rectify a disparity in MOD regulations over the use of Unit badges on memorials.
attributes.background: The three Services have their own rules for which names, Crests or Unit Badges can be used on private, family instigated memorials and/or their headstone, post mortem. The Royal Navy and Army state that any amount of service is acceptable, where as the RAF can require as much as 20 years service

attributes.action: Educate students about mortgages/taxes/life skills etc in college/high school
attributes.background: Learning about mortgages etc should be compulsory for students as I don't know what it is, how it works etc and I'm in college. This gives the students better skills for life than what is currently taught in their citizenship/pshce lessons

attributes.action: Relieve Capita of their contract for assessing disabled people
attributes.background: Relieve Capita of their contract for assessing disabled people on the back of the revelations revealed in the Channel 4 Dispatches program that was aired on the 11th April 2016

attributes.action: Disestablish the Church of England and establish Britain as a secular state
attributes.background: CofE attendance is 765,000, representing 1.4% of England's population. The House of Lords has 26 CofE Bishops who participate in debates and vote in divisions, which involve decisions affecting the entire UK. This is wholly disproportionate to the size of the CofE's attendance and thus influence.

attributes.action: Auto British Citizenship for EU Citizens working here for more than 10 years.
attributes.background: Give automatic British Citizenship to EU Nationals living and working in the UK for more than 10 years that never committed a crime and never claimed benefits.
attributes.additional_details:
The current process to obtain British Citizenship is outdated, too expensive and does not reward law abiding EU citizens that have been working in the UK for a long time and contributing to the wealth and cultural richness of the UK. 

EU Citizens should not need to pay for ESOL Tests if they been living here for so long and have other UK qualifications at Level 2 or above. 

Work and tax records should be checked by simply asking the applicant to provide their National Insurance Number.

attributes.action: Regulate political campaign material and communications
attributes.background:
In the most recent UK referendum on membership of the EU, campaign materials & messages on both sides contained gross mistruths, irregularities and exaggeration.

Citizens must be able to rely on campaign messages which are clear, factual and informative so that we can submit fully informed votes
attributes.additional_details: The Electoral Commission regulates a lot of the process around elections & voting, but there is currently no regulation from any body on political campaign materials and messages. I propose that the EC's remit is extended to regulate this as well. This would enable the voting public to execute their democratic right in a fully informed way. As to ask people to make an important choice on anything other than independently-verified facts & information runs the risk of destabilising our democracy.

attributes.action: We call on the Government to offer anonymity to victims of revenge porn
attributes.background:
Last year the Coalition made it illegal to disclose private sexual photographs and videos with intent to cause distress. 

Offering anonymity to victims empowers them to come forward to get justice. They shouldn't have to suffer in silence to protect any privacy they have left.

attributes.action: Training to raise awareness of disability in the workplace and schools
attributes.background: Personally due to my own experience, I feel employers need an overview of how disabilities can affect someone. Also when a manager doesn’t know how to deal with someone with health issues, the easy route out is constructive dismissal instead of supporting.
attributes.additional_details: This is all due to lack of education or understanding. The Government should make workplace training about disability mandatory to raise awareness in the whole company. Schools should also have disability training as part of the national curriculum. This could change people’s attitudes towards disability.

attributes.action: Link time of raising earning threshold for Carers Allowance with the Living wage
attributes.background: Currently earnings after allowable deductions must be no more that £110 pw but because the National Living Wage for over 25s is £7.20hr. This means someone working 16 hrs a week will earn £115.20 per week. £5.20 more than the amount allowed to earn and are at risk of losing their Carer's Allowance
attributes.additional_details:
Unpaid carers save the UK £132 billion a year. For 2015/16, the overall NHS budget was around £116.4 billion. This comparison alone illustrates the net-worth of Carers and their contribution to the economy. It is therefore not unreasonable to suppose the Government values their worth and shows it in a meaningful way.

This petition calls on the Chancellor of the Exchequer to link the time of raising the earnings threshold for Carer's Allowance with that of the Living Wage rise.

attributes.action: Law Change for the Victim so Paedophiles/Sex Offenders cannot live in same area.
attributes.background: My daughter lives in fear on a daily basis living within close vicinity of the offender.  The offender was already on bail condition in relation to a previous case involving another child. He broke his bail conditions by approaching my daughter at school, by asking for her items of underwear.
attributes.additional_details:
The Law needs to change so that victims no longer live in fear, of seeing their abuser within their home towns.  This will help victims to start regain confidence from fear, and living their lives once more.
This individual has come into your child's life uninvited, caused emotional stress and constant trauma, self-harming, to the point they don't want to live.  My daughters abuser was given 300 hours Community Service, 3 years on the Sex Offenders Register and a Community Payback Order.
